sauv:
pv: symbole/vide.png
pv2:
caracteristiques: \n\n---\n\n### **VARIOUS RULES**\n\n**D20 Test**: Attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws follow these steps:\n\n**1. Roll a d20.** With **Advantage** or **Disadvantage**, roll **2d20** and keep the **highest** (**Advantage**) or **lowest** (**Disadvantage**) result.\n\n**2. Add modifiers:** **Ability modifier**, **Proficiency bonus** (if applicable), and **situational modifiers** (features, spells, items, rules).\n\n**3. Compare to the target number.** If the total meets or exceeds the target, the check succeeds; otherwise, it fails. The **Difficulty Class (DC)** applies to **ability checks** and **saving throws**, while **Armor Class (AC)** applies to attack rolls.\n\n**Heroic Inspiration**: Immediately reroll a die after making a roll. If you gain Inspiration while already having it, you can give it to another player.\n\n**Saving Throw (ST)**: A roll to resist or avoid an effect, which can be failed voluntarily. Without proficiency in the relevant ability, the save automatically fails.\n\n**Ability Check**: Measures skill or training against an uncertain challenge. Named according to the **ability used** (**Strength, Intelligence, etc.**).\n\n**Proficiency Bonus**: Added to checks when proficient in a relevant skill or tool.\n\n**Difficulty Class (DC)**: Indicates the challenge difficulty. The **higher** the DC, the harder the task.\n\n**Attack Roll**: Determines if an attack hits by rolling **equal to or higher than the target's AC**. Uses **Strength** (melee), **Dexterity** (ranged), or the **spellcasting ability** for spell attacks. The **Proficiency bonus** applies if proficient with the weapon or spell used.\n\n**Cover**: Provides protection at three levels: **Partial Cover** (**+2 AC and Dexterity STs**), **Significant Cover** (**+5 AC and Dexterity STs**), and **Total Cover** (**untargetable**).\n\n**Darkness**: An area of darkness is **completely obscured**. You are considered **Blinded** while trying to see inside it.\n\n**Short Rest**: **1 hour** of rest without exertion, spellcasting, or combat. Allows spending **Hit Dice** to regain **HP** and refreshes certain abilities.\n\n**Long Rest**: **8 hours** (6 hours sleeping, 2 hours light activity). Restores **all HP**, **Hit Dice**, and reduces **Exhaustion by 1**. Interrupted by damage or spellcasting (except cantrips).\n\n**Reach**: The distance a creature can make melee attacks, usually **5' (1.5 m, 1 sq)** around them.\n\n**Melee Attack**: Attacks within **reach** using a **melee weapon** or **Unarmed Strike**. Some monsters use claws, fangs, or other body parts, and some spells involve melee attacks.\n\n**Opportunity Attack**: You can make a **Reaction** to attack a visible creature leaving your **reach** with a **melee attack**.\n\n**Avoiding Opportunity Attacks**: No **Opportunity Attack** occurs if using **Disengage**, **teleporting**, or being moved **without using your movement, Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction** (e.g., explosion, fall).\n\n**Hit Points (HP)**: Represent your endurance and will to survive. Your maximum HP is your full total when uninjured.\n\n**Bloodied**: If you fall to **half or fewer HP**, which may trigger effects but has no direct impact.\n\n**Temporary HP**: Absorbs damage before HP. They **don’t stack**—you keep either the **old** or **new** total. They aren’t **real HP**, can’t be restored, and don’t restore consciousness.\n\n
don: <br>\n\n### **ACTIONS**\n\nActions represent specific tasks performed on your turn. You can take **one action** per turn unless a rule states otherwise. Here are the main ones:\n\n- **Attack**: Make an **attack roll**. You can **equip/unequip** a weapon and **move between multiple attacks**.\n\n- **Dash**: Doubles one of your **Speeds** for this turn.\n\n- **Disengage**: Until the end of your turn, your movement does not provoke **opportunity attacks**.\n\n- **Dodge**: Until your next turn, if you have **Speed**, are not **Incapacitated**, and can see the attacker, all **attack rolls** against you have **Disadvantage**, and your **Dexterity Saving Throws** have **Advantage**.\n\n- **Help**: Grants **Advantage** to an ally’s **ability check** before your next turn or to their **first attack roll** against a creature **within your reach**.\n\n- **Hide**: While out of sight, in **darkness**, behind **significant cover**, or **total cover**, succeed on a **Dexterity (Stealth) check DC 15** to become **Invisible**. Your result becomes the **DC** for a creature’s **Perception check** to detect you. The effect ends if you **make noise**, **are spotted**, **attack**, or **cast a verbal spell**.\n\n- **Influence**: To persuade a creature, the DM determines if it is **willing** (no check needed), **unwilling** (impossible), or **hesitant** (requires a check: **DC 15 or the creature’s Intelligence, whichever is higher**). The check depends on the method: **Deception, Intimidation, Performance, Persuasion (Charisma)**, or **Animal Handling (Wisdom)**. On failure, you must wait **24 hours** or as decided by the DM before retrying.\n\n- **Cast a Spell**: Cast a spell that requires an **action**. If the spell has a longer duration, you must repeat this action each turn until completion.\n\n- **Ready**: Define a **trigger** and an **action** to take when it occurs. If readying a spell, you must maintain **Concentration**.\n\n- **Search**: Make a **Wisdom or Intelligence check** to find hidden clues or details (**Perception**, hidden objects, **Medicine**, cause of death, etc.).\n\n- **Study**: Make an **Intelligence check** to gain information in a relevant field (**Arcana** for magic, **History** for lore, etc.).\n\n- **Use an Object**: Required for activating or using specific items.\n\n- Other actions may be improvised or granted by class abilities.\n\n**Bonus Actions**: You can take **only one Bonus Action** per turn and only if a rule allows it.\n\n**Reactions**: A special action triggered by a specific event (e.g., **Opportunity Attack**). Only one Reaction per turn, taken **immediately after** the trigger.\n\n**Conditions**:\n\n- **Prone**: You **crawl** (**double movement cost**) or use **half your Speed** to stand up (**impossible if Speed is 0**). Your **attacks have Disadvantage**. Melee attacks against you have **Advantage**, while ranged attacks have **Disadvantage**.\n\n- **Deafened**: You can’t hear and automatically fail checks requiring hearing.\n\n- **Blinded**: You can’t see, fail checks relying on sight, **attack rolls have Disadvantage**, and attack rolls against you have **Advantage**.\n\n- **Charmed**: You can’t attack or harm the charmer, who has **Advantage** on social interactions with you.\n\n- **Grappled**: **Speed is 0**, **Disadvantage on attacks** except against the grappler, who can move you at **double the cost**. Ends if the grappler is **Incapacitated**, moves away, or you succeed on a **Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check** against their **Escape DC** (**8 + Proficiency bonus + Strength modifier**).\n\n- **Poisoned**: **Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks**.\n\n- **Restrained**: **Speed is 0**. Attacks against you have **Advantage**, your attacks have **Disadvantage**, and **Dexterity Saving Throws** have **Disadvantage**.\n\n- **Stunned**: **Incapacitated**, automatically fails **Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws**, and attacks against you have **Advantage**.\n\n- **Unconscious**: **Incapacitated and Prone**, drop everything held. **Speed is 0**, attacks against you have **Advantage**, and melee hits are **critical hits**. Unaware of surroundings.\n\n- **Invisible**: You can’t be targeted by attacks requiring sight unless the enemy senses you. Your **attacks have Advantage**, while attacks against you have **Disadvantage**.\n\n- **Incapacitated**: You can’t take **Actions, Bonus Actions, or Reactions**, lose **Concentration**, and can’t speak.\n\n- **Paralyzed**: **Incapacitated, Speed is 0**, automatically fails **Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws**, attacks against you have **Advantage**, and melee hits are **critical hits**.\n\n- **Petrified**: Turned to solid material, **weight ×10**, stops aging. **Incapacitated, Speed is 0**, automatically fails **Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws**, attacks against you have **Advantage**. **Resistant to all damage, Immune to Poison**.\n\n- **Frightened**: **Disadvantage on all rolls** while the source of fear is visible. You can’t willingly move closer to it.\n\n- **Exhaustion**: Each level reduces all **D20 rolls by 2 × exhaustion level** and **Speed by 5' (1.5 m, 1 sq) × exhaustion level**. At **6 levels**, you die. A **long rest** reduces Exhaustion by **1**.\n\n**Damage and Resistances**: A **damage roll** combines **damage dice, modifiers, and penalties**. A **critical hit (20)** doubles the **damage dice**. Damage from a **Saving Throw** is the same for all targets. A successful **Saving Throw** often halves damage (**rounding down**). Each damage type (**slashing, fire, etc.**) interacts with **Resistance (half damage), Vulnerability (double damage), and Immunity (no damage)**. Multiple resistances or vulnerabilities of the same type **do not stack**.\n\n**Damage Application Order**: 1. **Bonuses/penalties and multipliers**. 2. **Resistance (half damage)**. 3. **Vulnerability (double damage)**.\n\n**Healing**: Magic and rest restore **HP** but cannot exceed your maximum HP.\n\n**0 Hit Points**: You become **Unconscious** or **die instantly** if remaining damage after dropping to **0 HP** is **equal to or greater than your HP max**.\n\n**Death Saving Throws**: At **0 HP**, roll **1d20** at the start of each turn: **10+ is a success, 9- is a failure**. **3 successes** = **Stable**. **3 failures** = **Dead**. A natural **1** counts as **2 failures**, while a natural **20** grants **1 HP**. A **critical hit** or damage **equal to your HP max** kills instantly.\n\n**Stabilizing**: A **Wisdom (Medicine) check DC 10** stabilizes a creature at **0 HP**, stopping death saves. A stable creature regains **1 HP after 1d4 hours** if untreated.
donsuite: <br><br><br>\n\n# **Cleric**\n\n**A radiant figure emerges from the darkness, carrying the brilliant light of divine power. Clerics, chosen of the gods,<br> embody celestial will and perform miracles beyond mortal comprehension.**\n\nClerics are sacred champions, guided by unwavering faith and a direct connection to divine entities. They do not merely preach the word of the heavens or the abyss; they are its living expression, channeling divine energies to heal, protect, or strike down those who threaten sacred balance. Whether within a grand temple or on the battlefield, clerics are pillars of strength, wisdom, and devotion.\n\n## **Life Domain**\n\n*“The light of creation heals all wounds and warms all souls.”*<br>\n\nClerics of the Life Domain are bearers of benevolent and protective energy. With each prayer, they breathe new vigor into their allies and restore what has been broken. Devoted to preserving life and repelling the forces of destruction, they are beacons of hope in the darkest hours.\n\n## **Light Domain**\n\n*“Light pierces all shadows and reveals hidden truth.”*<br>\n\nClerics of the Light Domain wield the burning power of the sun and divine flames. They illuminate falsehoods and purify darkness, guiding the lost while reducing malevolent forces to ashes. Their radiant faith is a bulwark against despair and a weapon against creatures of shadow.\n\n## **Trickery Domain**\n\n*“A smile is a blade, and every word is a carefully woven trap.”*<br>\n\nClerics of the Trickery Domain master the subtle art of deception in service of divine causes. Whether toppling tyrants or unraveling conspiracies, they manipulate appearances and obscure certainties. Their faith lies in finesse and wit, revealing truths that others prefer to ignore.\n\n## **War Domain**\n\n*“Blessed steel is the prayer of champions, and victory their offering.”*<br>\n\nClerics of the War Domain are paragons of martial strength, blessed by gods of battle. On the front lines, they inspire their allies and strike with sacred power. Protectors and conquerors alike, they wield weapons and prayers with equal fervor, embodying the glory of warrior deities.\n\n---\n\n# **The Cleric**\n\n| Level | Proficiency Bonus | Class Features                          | Channel<br>Divine Energy | Magic<br>Turns | Spells<br>Prepared | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | 6 | 7 | 8 | 9                  | Divine Domain Feature               | 3                    | 5              | 19            | 4 | 3 | 3 | 3 | 2 | 1 | 1 | 1 | 1 |\n| 18     | +6                  | —      | 5              | 21            | 4 | 3 | 3 | 3 | 3 | 2 | 1 | 1 | 1 |\n| 20     | +6                  | Greater Divine Intervention         | 4                    | 5              | 22 caracteristiques: \n\n---\n\n**Primary Ability:** **Wisdom**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Hit Dice:** **1d8** per **Cleric level**\n\n**Proficiencies:**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Saving Throw Proficiencies:** **Wisdom** and **Charisma**\n\n- **Weapons:** **Simple weapons**\n\n- **Armor:** **Light armor**, **Medium armor**, and **Shields**\n\n**Skill Proficiencies** (choose 2): **History**, **Persuasion**, **Medicine**, **Insight**, or **Religion**<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)
don: ### **Class Features**\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 1**. **Spellcasting (Cleric)**: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Concentration**. All **spell slots** are regained after a **Long Rest** \n\n>- **Swap Prepared Spells**: After a **Long Rest**, replace prepared spells with others (for which you have slots). After each **Cleric level**, you can swap **one cantrip**.\n>- **Spellcasting Ability**: **Wisdom**.\n>- **Spellcasting Focus**: You can use a **Holy Symbol** to cast spells. Replaces non-costly material components.\n\n|Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | **Expended<br>Slots** |Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | **Expended<br>Slots** |Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | donsuite: <br><br>\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 2**. **Channel Divinity**: Total Uses: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) You regain 1 use after a **Short Rest** and all after a **Long Rest**.\n\n>- **Divine Spark**: **Magical Action**. Target a visible creature within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)**. Roll **1d8 + Wisdom Mod**. Either **heal** an ally by this amount or an enemy takes <br>**Necrotic or Radiant Damage** (**Constitution Saving Throw**, **Spell Save DC** to halve damage). **Extra d8s** at Cleric Levels: <br>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**: **2d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 13**: **3d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 18**: **4d8**.\n\n>- **Turn Undead**: **Magical Action**. All **Undead** of your choice within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** must make a **Wisdom Saving Throw** or become **Frightened** and **Incapacitated** for **1 min**, fleeing as far as possible. The effect ends if they take **damage**, if you become **Incapacitated**, or if you die.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 3**. **Disciple of Life**: When one of your spells (cast with a spell slot) **heals HP**, the target regains **2 + spell slot level** **extra HP** (only on the **turn** you cast the spell).\n\n> **Life Domain Spells**: Always prepared.\n\n| **Cleric Level** | **Spells** |\n|---|---|\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **3** | **Aid, Bless, Cure Wounds, Lesser Restoration** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **5** | **Mass Healing Word, Revivify** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **7** | **Aura of Life, Death Ward** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **9** | **Greater Restoration, Mass Cure Wounds** |\n\n> **Preserve Life**: **Magical Action**, spend 1 use of **Channel Divinity** to distribute up to **5 x Cleric level** **HP** among **bloodied** creatures (at half HP or less) within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** of you. No target can exceed half of their **max HP** from this healing.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Levels 4, 8, 12, 16** \n\n> **Ability Score Improvement**: **+2 to 1 ability**, or **+1 to 2 abilities**, or **1 Feat**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 5**. **Sear Undead**: When you use **Turn Undead**, you deal (**Wisdom Mod**, **min 1**) ![Case!](symbole/caseD.png)**d8 Radiant Damage** to each target that fails its save.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 6**. **Blessed Healer**: When you cast a spell (using a spell slot) that **heals HP** for others, you regain **2 + spell slot level** **HP**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**. **Blessed Strikes**: Choose 1 of the following options:\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Divine Strike**: Once per turn, when you **hit** a target with a weapon attack, it takes an additional **1d8** **Necrotic or Radiant Damage**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14**: Additional damage increases to **2d8**.\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Potent Spellcasting**: Add your **Wisdom Mod** to the damage of your **Cleric cantrips**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14**: When you cast a **Cleric cantrip** that deals damage, you or an ally within **60' (18 m, 12 sq)** gain **temporary HP** = **2 x Wisdom Mod**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 10**. **Divine Intervention** ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png): **Magical Action**. Choose a **Cleric spell of level 5 or lower** without reaction; you cast it **without a spell slot** or material components. Usable again after a **Long Rest**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 17**. **Supreme Healing**: When you would normally roll dice to heal a creature (with a spell or **Channel Divinity**), do not roll. Instead, use the maximum value of each die. For example, instead of restoring **3d6 HP**, you restore **18 HP** directly.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 19**. **Epic Boon**: You gain an **Epic Boon** or another **Feat** of your choice: ![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 20**. **Greater Divine Intervention**: When you use **Divine Intervention**, you can choose *Wish* as the spell. If you do, you cannot use this feature again for **2d4 Long Rests**. Total days: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Days passed: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)\n\n---\n\n<br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)

caracteristiques: \n\n---\n\n**Primary Ability:** Throw Proficiencies:** **Wisdom** and **Charisma**\n\n- **Weapons:** **Simple weapons**\n\n- **Armor:** **Light armor**, **Medium armor**, and **Shields**\n\n**Skill Proficiencies** (choose 2): **History**, **Persuasion**, **Medicine**, **Insight**, or don: ### **Class Features**\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 1**. **Spellcasting (Cleric)**: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Concentration**. All **spell slots** are regained after a **Long Rest** \n\n>- **Swap Prepared Spells**: After a **Long Rest**, replace prepared spells with others (for which you have slots). After each **Cleric level**, you can swap **one cantrip**.\n>- **Spellcasting Ability**: **Wisdom**.\n>- **Spellcasting Focus**: You can use a **Holy Symbol** to cast spells. donsuite: <br><br>\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 2**. **Channel Divinity**: Total Uses: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) You regain 1 use after a **Short Rest** and all after a **Long Rest**.\n\n>- **Divine Spark**: **Magical Action**. Target a visible creature within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)**. Roll **1d8 + Wisdom Mod**. Either **heal** an ally by this amount or an enemy takes <br>**Necrotic or Radiant Damage** (**Constitution Saving Throw**, **Spell Save DC** to halve damage). **Extra d8s** at Cleric Levels: <br>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**: **2d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 13**: **3d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 18**: **4d8**.\n\n>- **Turn Undead**: **Magical Action**. All **Undead** of your choice within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** must make a **Wisdom Saving Throw** or become **Frightened** and **Incapacitated** for **1 min**, fleeing as far as possible. The effect ends if they take **damage**, if you become **Incapacitated**, or if you die.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 3**. **Light Domain Spells**: Always prepared.\n\n| **Cleric Level** | **Spells** |\n|---|---|\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **3** | **Burning Hands, Faerie Fire, Scorching Ray, See Invisibility** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **5** | **Daylight, Fireball** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **7** | **Arcane Eye, Wall of Fire** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **9** | **Flame Strike, Scrying** |\n\n> **Radiance of the Dawn**: **Magical Action**, present your **Holy Symbol** and spend a use of **Channel Divinity** to dispel magical darkness within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)**. Targets of your choice failing a **Constitution Saving Throw** take **2d10 + your Cleric Level Radiant Damage** (half on success).\n\n> **Warding Flare** Total Uses: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png): **Reaction**. When a creature you see within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** makes an attack, you impose **Disadvantage** on the roll. Usable a number of times equal to **Wisdom Mod** (**min 1**), regained after a **Long Rest**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Levels 4, 8, 12, and 16**. **Ability Score Improvement**: Choose: **+2 to one ability**, or **+1 to two abilities**, or **one feat**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 5**. **Sear Undead**: When you use **Turn Undead**, you deal (**Wisdom Mod**, **min 1**) ![Case!](symbole/caseD.png)**d8 Radiant Damage** to each target that fails its save.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 6**. **Improved Warding Flare**: You regain all uses of **Warding Flare** after a **Short Rest** or **Long Rest**. Additionally, when you use it, you can grant **2d6 + Wisdom Mod Temporary HP** to the target of the attack triggering **Warding Flare**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**. **Blessed Strikes**: Choose one of the following options:\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Divine Strike**: Once per turn, when you **hit** a target with a weapon attack, it takes an additional **1d8** **Necrotic or Radiant Damage**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14**: Additional damage increases to **2d8**.\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Potent Spellcasting**: Add your **Wisdom Mod** to the damage of your **Cleric cantrips**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14**: When you cast a **Cleric cantrip** that deals damage, you or an ally within **60' (18 m, 12 sq)** gain **Temporary HP** equal to **2 × Wisdom Mod**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 10**. **Divine Intervention** ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png): **Magical Action**. Choose a **Cleric spell of level 5 or lower** without reaction; you cast it **without a spell slot** or material components. Usable again after a **Long Rest**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 17**. **Corona of Light** Total Uses: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png): **Magical Action**, you emit a **solar aura** lasting **1 min** or until you dismiss it (no action required). The light shines brightly for **60' (18 m, 12 sq)** and dimly for another **30' (9 m, 6 sq)**. Enemies in this area have **Disadvantage** on **Saving Throws** against your **Radiance of the Dawn** and **Fire or Radiant Spells**. Usable a number of times equal to **Wisdom Mod** (**min 1**), regained after a **Long Rest**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 19**. **Epic Boon**: You gain an **Epic Boon** or another **Feat** of your choice: ![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 20**. **Greater Divine Intervention**: When you use **Divine Intervention**, you can choose *Wish* as the spell. If you do, you cannot use this feature again for **2d4 Long Rests**. Total days: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Days passed: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)\n\n---\n\n<br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)

additional **cantrip** and bonus in **(Arcana/Religion)** = **Wisdom Mod** (**min +1**). |\n\n **Feats** donsuite: <br><br>\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 2**. **Channel Divinity**: Total Uses: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) You regain 1 use after a **Short Rest** and all after a **Long Rest**.\n\n>- **Divine Spark**: **Magical Action**. Target a visible creature within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)**. Roll **1d8 + Wisdom Mod**. Either **heal** an ally by this amount or an enemy takes <br>**Necrotic or Radiant Damage** (**Constitution Saving Throw**, **Spell Save DC** to halve damage). **Extra d8s** at Cleric Levels: <br>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**: **2d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 13**: **3d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 18**: **4d8**.\n\n>- **Turn Undead**: **Magical Action**. All **Undead** of your choice within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** must make a **Wisdom Saving Throw** or become **Frightened** and **Incapacitated** for **1 min**, fleeing as far as possible. The effect ends if they take **damage**, if you become **Incapacitated**, or if you die.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 3**. **War Domain Spells**: Always prepared.\n\n| **Cleric Level** | **Spells** |\n|---|---|\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **3** | **Guiding Bolt, Magic Weapon, Shield of Faith, Spiritual Weapon** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **5** | **Crusader's Mantle, Spirit Guardians** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **7** | **Fire Shield, Freedom of Movement** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **9** | **Hold Monster, Steel Wind Strike** |\n\n> **Guided Strike**: When you or a creature within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** misses an attack, you can expend 1 use of **Channel Divinity** to **add +10** to the roll (if for another creature, use a **reaction**).\n\n> **War Priest**. Total Uses: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png). As a **Bonus Action**, you can make an additional **Weapon Attack** (or Unarmed Strike). Uses per **Wis Mod** (**min 1**). Regains all uses after a **Short or Long Rest**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Levels 4, 8, 12, 16**. **Ability Score Improvement**: Choose **+2 to one ability**, **+1 to two abilities**, or **one Feat**.\n\n ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 5**. **Sear Undead**: When you use **Turn Undead**, you deal (**Wis Mod**, **min 1**) ![Case!](symbole/caseD.png)**d8 Radiant Damage** to each target that fails its save.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 6**. **War God’s Blessing**: By expending 1 use of **Channel Divinity**, you can cast **Shield of Faith** or **Spiritual Weapon** **without a spell slot**. No **Concentration** required, lasts **1 min** (ends if you cast another spell, die, or become **Incapacitated**).\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**. **Blessed Strikes**: Choose 1 of the following options:\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Divine Strike**: Once per turn, when you **hit** a target with a weapon attack, it takes an extra **1d8 Necrotic or Radiant Damage**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14**: The extra damage increases to **2d8**.\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Potent Spellcasting**: Add your **Wis Mod** to the damage of your **Cleric cantrips**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14**: When you cast a **Cleric cantrip** that deals damage, you or an ally within **60' (18 m, 12 sq)** gains **Temp HP** = **2 × Wis Mod**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 10**. **Divine Intervention** ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png): **Magical Action**. Choose a **Cleric spell** of **5th level or lower** without reaction, you cast it **without expending a spell slot** or material components. Usable again after a **Long Rest**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 17**. **Avatar of Battle**: You gain **Resistance** to **Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 19**. **Epic Boon**: You gain an **Epic Boon** or another **Feat** of your choice: ![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 20**. **Greater Divine Intervention**: When you use **Divine Intervention**, you can choose *Wish* as the spell. If you do, you cannot use this feature again for **2d4 Long Rests**. Total days: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Days passed: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)\n\n---\n\n<br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)

**Wisdom**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Hit Dice:** **1d8** per **Cleric level**\n\n**Proficiencies:**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Saving Throw Proficiencies:** **Wisdom** and **Charisma**\n\n- **Weapons:** **Simple weapons**\n\n- **Armor:** **Light armor**, **Medium armor**, and **Shields**\n\n**Skill Proficiencies** (choose 2): **History**, **Persuasion**, **Medicine**, **Insight**, or don: ### **Class Features**\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 1**. **Spellcasting (Cleric)**: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Concentration**. All **spell slots** are regained after a **Long Rest** \n\n>- **Swap Prepared Spells**: After a **Long Rest**, replace prepared spells with others (for which you have slots). After each **Cleric level**, you can swap **one cantrip**.\n>- **Spellcasting Ability**: **Wisdom**.\n>- **Spellcasting Focus**: You can use a **Holy Symbol** to cast spells. \n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n---\n\n<br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)
donsuite: <br><br>\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 2**. **Channel Divinity**: Total Uses: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) You regain 1 use after a **Short Rest** and all after a **Long Rest**.\n\n>- **Divine Spark**: **Magical Action**. Target a visible creature within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)**. Roll **1d8 + Wisdom Mod**. Either **heal** an ally by this amount or an enemy takes <br>**Necrotic or Radiant Damage** (**Constitution Saving Throw**, **Spell Save DC** to halve damage). **Extra d8s** at Cleric Levels: <br>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**: **2d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 13**: **3d8**, ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 18**: **4d8**.\n\n>- **Turn Undead**: **Magical Action**. All **Undead** of your choice within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** must make a **Wisdom Saving Throw** or become **Frightened** and **Incapacitated** for **1 min**, fleeing as far as possible. The effect ends if they take **damage**, if you become **Incapacitated**, or if you die.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 3**. **Trickery Domain Spells** : Always prepared.\n\n| **Cleric Level** | **Spells** |\n|---|---|\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **3** | **Charm Person, Disguise Self, Invisibility, Pass Without Trace** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **5** | **Hypnotic Pattern, Nondetection** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **7** | **Confusion, Dimension Door** |\n| ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **9** | **Dominate Person, Modify Memory** |\n\n> **Blessing of the Trickster** : **Magical Action**. You or a willing creature within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** gains **Advantage** on **Dexterity (Stealth) checks** until the end of a **long rest** or until you use this blessing again.\n\n> **Invoke Duplicity** : **Bonus Action**, spend **1 use** of **Channel Divinity** to create a **perfect illusory duplicate** (intangible) of yourself within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** that you can see. It lasts **1 min** (unless you dismiss it, die, or become **Incapacitated**). You can cast spells as if you were at the illusion’s location, and if both you and the illusion are within **5' (1.5 m, 1 sq)** of the same target, your attacks have **Advantage** (since the target is distracted). As a **Bonus Action**, you can move the illusion up to **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** to an unoccupied space you can see within **120' (36 m, 24 sq)**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Levels 4, 8, 12, and 16**. **Ability Score Improvement** : Choose: **+2 to one ability score**, or **+1 to two ability scores**, or **one feat**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 5**. **Sear Undead** : When you use **Turn Undead**, you deal (**Wisdom Mod**, **min 1**) ![Case!](symbole/caseD.png)**d8 Radiant Damage** to each target that fails its saving throw.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 6**. **Trickster’s Transposition** : Whenever you use a **Bonus Action** to create or move your illusion (**Invoke Duplicity**), you can **teleport**, swapping places with the illusion.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**. **Blessed Strikes** : Choose 1 option:\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Divine Strike** : Once per turn, when you **hit** a target with a weapon attack, it takes an additional **1d8** **Necrotic or Radiant Damage**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14** : Additional damage increases to **2d8**.\n\n>- ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Potent Spellcasting** : Add your **Wisdom Mod** to the damage of your **Cleric Cantrips**.\n\n>>>![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14** **Temp HP** ![Case!](symbole/caseD.png): When you cast a **Cleric Cantrip** that deals damage, you or an ally within **60' (18 m, 12 sq)** gains **Temp HP** = **2 × Wisdom Mod**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 10** :  **Divine Intervention** ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) : **Magical Action**. Choose a **Cleric Spell** **level 5 or lower** without reaction, you cast it **without expending a slot** or material components. Usable again after a **long rest**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 17**. **Improved Duplicity** : Your illusion from **Invoke Duplicity** is enhanced:\n\n>- **Shared Distraction** : As long as the illusion is within **5' (1.5 m, 1 sq)** of a target, **you and your allies** gain **Advantage** on attacks against it.\n\n>- **Healing Illusion** : When the illusion disappears, you or a creature within **5' (1.5 m, 1 sq)** of it regains **HP equal to your Cleric Level**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 19**. **Epic Boon** : You gain an **Epic Boon** or another **Feat** of your choice: ![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 20**. **Greater Divine Intervention** : When you use **Divine Intervention**, you can choose *Wish* as the spell. If you do, you cannot use this feature again for **2d4 long rests**. Total days: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png) Days elapsed: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)\n\n---\n\n<br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)

nom: **Bard**
nom 1: **Bard**
type: Class
recto: arriere_plan/classe.png
symbole 1: symbole/vide.png

niveau:
DD5: 5e 2024 Compatible
DD5-2: 5e 2024 Compatible
sauv:
pv: symbole/vide.png
pv2:
caracteristiques: \n\n---\n\n### **VARIOUS RULES**\n\n**D20 Test**: Attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws follow these steps:\n\n**1. Roll a d20.** With **Advantage** or **Disadvantage**, roll **2d20** and keep the **highest** (**Advantage**) or **lowest** (**Disadvantage**) result.\n\n**2. Add modifiers:** **Ability modifier**, **Proficiency bonus** (if applicable), and **situational modifiers** (features, spells, items, rules).\n\n**3. Compare to the target number.** If the total meets or exceeds the target, the check succeeds; otherwise, it fails. The **Difficulty Class (DC)** applies to **ability checks** and **saving throws**, while **Armor Class (AC)** applies to attack rolls.\n\n**Heroic Inspiration**: Immediately reroll a die after making a roll. If you gain Inspiration while already having it, you can give it to another player.\n\n**Saving Throw (ST)**: A roll to resist or avoid an effect, which can be failed voluntarily. Without proficiency in the relevant ability, the save automatically fails.\n\n**Ability Check**: Measures skill or training against an uncertain challenge. Named according to the **ability used** (**Strength, Intelligence, etc.**).\n\n**Proficiency Bonus**: Added to checks when proficient in a relevant skill or tool.\n\n**Difficulty Class (DC)**: Indicates the challenge difficulty. The **higher** the DC, the harder the task.\n\n**Attack Roll**: Determines if an attack hits by rolling **equal to or higher than the target's AC**. Uses **Strength** (melee), **Dexterity** (ranged), or the **spellcasting ability** for spell attacks. The **Proficiency bonus** applies if proficient with the weapon or spell used.\n\n**Cover**: Provides protection at three levels: **Partial Cover** (**+2 AC and Dexterity STs**), **Significant Cover** (**+5 AC and Dexterity STs**), and **Total Cover** (**untargetable**).\n\n**Darkness**: An area of darkness is **completely obscured**. You are considered **Blinded** while trying to see inside it.\n\n**Short Rest**: **1 hour** of rest without exertion, spellcasting, or combat. Allows spending **Hit Dice** to regain **HP** and refreshes certain abilities.\n\n**Long Rest**: **8 hours** (6 hours sleeping, 2 hours light activity). Restores **all HP**, **Hit Dice**, and reduces **Exhaustion by 1**. Interrupted by damage or spellcasting (except cantrips).\n\n**Reach**: The distance a creature can make melee attacks, usually **5' (1.5 m, 1 sq)** around them.\n\n**Melee Attack**: Attacks within **reach** using a **melee weapon** or **Unarmed Strike**. Some monsters use claws, fangs, or other body parts, and some spells involve melee attacks.\n\n**Opportunity Attack**: You can make a **Reaction** to attack a visible creature leaving your **reach** with a **melee attack**.\n\n**Avoiding Opportunity Attacks**: No **Opportunity Attack** occurs if using **Disengage**, **teleporting**, or being moved **without using your movement, Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction** (e.g., explosion, fall).\n\n**Hit Points (HP)**: Represent your endurance and will to survive. Your maximum HP is your full total when uninjured.\n\n**Bloodied**: If you fall to **half or fewer HP**, which may trigger effects but has no direct impact.\n\n**Temporary HP**: Absorbs damage before HP. They **don’t stack**—you keep either the **old** or **new** total. They aren’t **real HP**, can’t be restored, and don’t restore consciousness.\n\n
don: <br>\n\n### **ACTIONS**\n\nActions represent specific tasks performed on your turn. You can take **one action** per turn unless a rule states otherwise. Here are the main ones:\n\n- **Attack**: Make an **attack roll**. You can **equip/unequip** a weapon and **move between multiple attacks**.\n\n- **Dash**: Doubles one of your **Speeds** for this turn.\n\n- **Disengage**: Until the end of your turn, your movement does not provoke **opportunity attacks**.\n\n- **Dodge**: Until your next turn, if you have **Speed**, are not **Incapacitated**, and can see the attacker, all **attack rolls** against you have **Disadvantage**, and your **Dexterity Saving Throws** have **Advantage**.\n\n- **Help**: Grants **Advantage** to an ally’s **ability check** before your next turn or to their **first attack roll** against a creature **within your reach**.\n\n- **Hide**: While out of sight, in **darkness**, behind **significant cover**, or **total cover**, succeed on a **Dexterity (Stealth) check DC 15** to become **Invisible**. Your result becomes the **DC** for a creature’s **Perception check** to detect you. The effect ends if you **make noise**, **are spotted**, **attack**, or **cast a verbal spell**.\n\n- **Influence**: To persuade a creature, the DM determines if it is **willing** (no check needed), **unwilling** (impossible), or **hesitant** (requires a check: **DC 15 or the creature’s Intelligence, whichever is higher**). The check depends on the method: **Deception, Intimidation, Performance, Persuasion (Charisma)**, or **Animal Handling (Wisdom)**. On failure, you must wait **24 hours** or as decided by the DM before retrying.\n\n- **Cast a Spell**: Cast a spell that requires an **action**. If the spell has a longer duration, you must repeat this action each turn until completion.\n\n- **Ready**: Define a **trigger** and an **action** to take when it occurs. If readying a spell, you must maintain **Concentration**.\n\n- **Search**: Make a **Wisdom or Intelligence check** to find hidden clues or details (**Perception**, hidden objects, **Medicine**, cause of death, etc.).\n\n- **Study**: Make an **Intelligence check** to gain information in a relevant field (**Arcana** for magic, **History** for lore, etc.).\n\n- **Use an Object**: Required for activating or using specific items.\n\n- Other actions may be improvised or granted by class abilities.\n\n**Bonus Actions**: You can take **only one Bonus Action** per turn and only if a rule allows it.\n\n**Reactions**: A special action triggered by a specific event (e.g., **Opportunity Attack**). Only one Reaction per turn, taken **immediately after** the trigger.\n\n**Conditions**:\n\n- **Prone**: You **crawl** (**double movement cost**) or use **half your Speed** to stand up (**impossible if Speed is 0**). Your **attacks have Disadvantage**. Melee attacks against you have **Advantage**, while ranged attacks have **Disadvantage**.\n\n- **Deafened**: You can’t hear and automatically fail checks requiring hearing.\n\n- **Blinded**: You can’t see, fail checks relying on sight, **attack rolls have Disadvantage**, and attack rolls against you have **Advantage**.\n\n- **Charmed**: You can’t attack or harm the charmer, who has **Advantage** on social interactions with you.\n\n- **Grappled**: **Speed is 0**, **Disadvantage on attacks** except against the grappler, who can move you at **double the cost**. Ends if the grappler is **Incapacitated**, moves away, or you succeed on a **Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check** against their **Escape DC** (**8 + Proficiency bonus + Strength modifier**).\n\n- **Poisoned**: **Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks**.\n\n- **Restrained**: **Speed is 0**. Attacks against you have **Advantage**, your attacks have **Disadvantage**, and **Dexterity Saving Throws** have **Disadvantage**.\n\n- **Stunned**: **Incapacitated**, automatically fails **Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws**, and attacks against you have **Advantage**.\n\n- **Unconscious**: **Incapacitated and Prone**, drop everything held. **Speed is 0**, attacks against you have **Advantage**, and melee hits are **critical hits**. Unaware of surroundings.\n\n- **Invisible**: You can’t be targeted by attacks requiring sight unless the enemy senses you. Your **attacks have Advantage**, while attacks against you have **Disadvantage**.\n\n- **Incapacitated**: You can’t take **Actions, Bonus Actions, or Reactions**, lose **Concentration**, and can’t speak.\n\n- **Paralyzed**: **Incapacitated, Speed is 0**, automatically fails **Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws**, attacks against you have **Advantage**, and melee hits are **critical hits**.\n\n- **Petrified**: Turned to solid material, **weight ×10**, stops aging. **Incapacitated, Speed is 0**, automatically fails **Strength and Dexterity Saving Throws**, attacks against you have **Advantage**. **Resistant to all damage, Immune to Poison**.\n\n- **Frightened**: **Disadvantage on all rolls** while the source of fear is visible. You can’t willingly move closer to it.\n\n- **Exhaustion**: Each level reduces all **D20 rolls by 2 × exhaustion level** and **Speed by 5' (1.5 m, 1 sq) × exhaustion level**. At **6 levels**, you die. A **long rest** reduces Exhaustion by **1**.\n\n**Damage and Resistances**: A **damage roll** combines **damage dice, modifiers, and penalties**. A **critical hit (20)** doubles the **damage dice**. Damage from a **Saving Throw** is the same for all targets. A successful **Saving Throw** often halves damage (**rounding down**). Each damage type (**slashing, fire, etc.**) interacts with **Resistance (half damage), Vulnerability (double damage), and Immunity (no damage)**. Multiple resistances or vulnerabilities of the same type **do not stack**.\n\n**Damage Application Order**: 1. **Bonuses/penalties and multipliers**. 2. **Resistance (half damage)**. 3. **Vulnerability (double damage)**.\n\n**Healing**: Magic and rest restore **HP** but cannot exceed your maximum HP.\n\n**0 Hit Points**: You become **Unconscious** or **die instantly** if remaining damage after dropping to **0 HP** is **equal to or greater than your HP max**.\n\n**Death Saving Throws**: At **0 HP**, roll **1d20** at the start of each turn: **10+ is a success, 9- is a failure**. **3 successes** = **Stable**. **3 failures** = **Dead**. A natural **1** counts as **2 failures**, while a natural **20** grants **1 HP**. A **critical hit** or damage **equal to your HP max** kills instantly.\n\n**Stabilizing**: A **Wisdom (Medicine) check DC 10** stabilizes a creature at **0 HP**, stopping death saves. A stable creature regains **1 HP after 1d4 hours** if untreated.
donsuite: <br><br><br>\n\n# **Bard**\n\n**In the heat of battle, in the dim corners of taverns, or on the dazzling stages of great cities, bards enchant the world with their tales,<br>melodies, and magic. They are the weavers of stories, keepers of legends, and bearers of timeless truths.**\n\nBards travel across realms, gathering knowledge and songs, blending magic with the arts to inspire, dazzle, or manipulate. With a single note or a well-placed word, they can rekindle hope in a broken heart, defuse an impending conflict, or make the walls of a fortress tremble. Artists, scholars, and magicians alike, they embody the power of living stories and the beauty of creative mastery.\n\n## **College of Dance**\n\n*“Every step tells a story; every twirl maps the stars.”*<br>\n\nBards of the College of Dance embrace an art where movement becomes a divine language. Their bodies, like celestial instruments, sing the symphony of the cosmos. Every motion, imbued with elegance and power, inspires and confounds. These bards dance with supernatural grace, turning both the stage and the battlefield into living canvases of magic and agility.\n\n## **College of Glamour**\n\n*“Look at me and lose yourself. My radiance will either guide or consume you.”*<br>\n\nThe College of Glamour was born from the beguiling mysteries of the Feywild. Its bards wield an irresistible beauty that ensnares minds and stirs souls. Through their ethereal songs and fae-inspired dances, they manipulate emotions, conjure visions of wonder or terror, and drape their allies in a majesty worthy of immortal courts. Their presence either uplifts or crushes, depending on their intent.\n\n## **College of Lore**\n\n*“Words are sharper than steel, and knowledge is a treasure that no one can steal.”*<br>\n\nBards of the College of Lore are scholars of the arts and arcane, archivists of the world’s knowledge. They seek wisdom in forgotten corners, unravel the deepest mysteries, and expose the lies of the powerful. Their sharp tongues and keen minds are their weapons, transforming complex conflicts into subtle victories. They are the keepers of truth, delivering it with eloquence or biting wit.\n\n## **College of Valor**\n\n*“Sing the tales of heroes, and their shadows shall rise to protect the living.”*<br>\n\nBards of the College of Valor celebrate the deeds of great champions, their courage, and sacrifices. They journey where history is written, often becoming part of the legends themselves. Through their epic songs, they bolster the hearts of their comrades, and their presence rallies warriors on the battlefield. With an instrument in hand and a blade at their side, these bards embody the legacy of immortal heroes.\n\n---\n\n# **The Bard**\n\n| Level | Proficiency<br>Bonus | Class Features | pv2: &nbsp;&nbsp; Hide<br>&nbsp;   &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Initiative&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;HP &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Speed&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;AC<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Max&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Temp&nbsp;&nbsp;Max&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Temp<br>&nbsp;Inspiration<br><br><br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp; XP<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="1"> &nbsp; Save&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reach 1<sup>st</sup> hand&nbsp;&nbsp;Reach 2<sup>nd</sup> hand<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;against&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Passive Wisdom<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; death&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(Perception)
caracteristiques: \n\n---\n\n**Primary Ability:** **Charisma**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Hit Dice:** **1d8** per **Bard level**\n\n**Proficiencies:**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Saving Throw Proficiencies:** **Dexterity** and **Charisma**\n\n- **Weapons:** **Simple Weapons**\n\n- **Armor:** **Light Armor**\n\n- **Tools** (choose 3 musical instruments)\n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n- **Proficient Skills** (choose 3):\n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)
don: ### **Class Feature**\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 1**. **Spellcasting (Bard)** : ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Concentration**. All your **spell slots** are regained after a **Long Rest**.\n\n>- **Replace Prepared Spells**: After each **Bard level**, you can swap one spell and one cantrip.\n>- **Spellcasting Ability**: **Charisma**.\n>- **Spellcasting Focus**: You can use a **Musical Instrument** to cast your spells. Replaces non-costly material components.\n\n|Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | **Used<br>Slots** |Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | **Used<br>Slots** |Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | |![Case!](symbole/caseD.png) | ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)|**Lv 6**|![Case!](symbole/caseD.png) | ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)|**Lv 9**|![Case!](symbole/caseD.png) | ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)|\n\n|**Current Spellcasting Values**||||\n|------|-----|------|------|\n|**Known Cantrips**|![Ligne!](symbole/caseD.png)|**Save DC** (**8** + **Proficiency Bonus** + **Charisma mod.**)|![Ligne!](symbole/caseD.png)|\n|**Prepared Spells**|![Ligne!](symbole/caseD.png)|**Spell Attack Modifier** (**Proficiency Bonus** + **Charisma mod.**)|![Ligne!](symbole/caseD.png)|\n\n> **Bardic Inspiration** ![case!](symbole/caseD.png), Total: ![case!](symbole/caseD.png), Used: ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)\n\n>> As a **Bonus Action**, grant a **Bardic Inspiration die** (**d6**) to a creature within **60' (18 m, 12 sq)** that can see or hear you (1 max per creature). Within the next hour, if the target fails a **D20 Roll**, they can roll the Bardic Inspiration die and **add** it to the result. The die is lost after use. You can use this feature **Charisma mod.** (**min 1**) times. You regain all uses after a **Long Rest**.\n\n>>**Die Progression**: at ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **level 5**: **d8**, at ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **level 10**: **d10**, at ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **level 15**: **d12**.\n\n **Feats** \n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n---\n\n<br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)
donsuite: <br>\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 2**. **Expertise** : Choose 2 proficient skills to double your **proficiency bonus**\n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n>> At **Level 9 ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)**, choose 2 additional skills.\n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n> **Jack of All Trades** : Add half your **proficiency bonus** (rounded down) ![Ligne!](symbole/caseD.png) to **ability checks** you are not proficient in.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 3**. **Dazzling Footwork**:\n\n>- **Dance Virtuoso**: **Advantage** on **Charisma (Performance) checks** involving dance.\n>- **Unarmored Defense**: If not wearing armor or using a shield, your **Base AC = 10 + Dexterity mod. + Charisma mod.**\n>- **Agile Strikes**: When you spend **a Bardic Inspiration die**, you can make an **unarmed strike** in the same **Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction**.\n>- **Bardic Damage**: Use **Dexterity** for your unarmed strikes. The Damage of an unarmed strike equals your **Bardic Inspiration die** + **Dexterity mod.** (without spending the **Bardic Inspiration die**). Type: **Bludgeoning**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png)![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Levels 4, 8, 12, and 16**. **Ability Score Improvement**: Choose **+2 to one ability**, or **+1 to two abilities**, or **one Feat**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 5**. **Font of Inspiration**: You regain all uses of **Bardic Inspiration** after a **Short Rest** or **Long Rest**. You can also spend a **spell slot** (no action required) to regain **one use of Bardic Inspiration**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 6**. **Inspiring Movement**: When an enemy ends its turn within **5' (1.5 m, 1 sq)** of you, you can use a **Reaction** and spend **a Bardic Inspiration die** to move up to half your **Speed** **without provoking Opportunity Attacks**. Then, an ally within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** can also spend their **Reaction** to move in the same way.\n\n> **Tandem Footwork**: When rolling for **Initiative**, if you are not **Incapacitated**, you can spend **a Bardic Inspiration die**. Roll this die and add the result to your Initiative, as well as to each ally within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** who can see or hear you.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 7**. **Countercharm**: If you or a creature within **30' (9 m, 6 sq)** fail a **Saving Throw** against **Charmed** or **Frightened**, you can use a **Reaction** to reroll the save with **Advantage**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 10**. **Magical Secrets**: When your prepared spell count increases (by leveling up), you can choose your new spells from the **Bard, Cleric, Druid, or Wizard** spell lists (they count as **Bard spells**). Additionally, each time you replace a **prepared spell** for this class, you can replace it with a spell from these lists.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 14**. **Leading Evasion**: When an effect requires a **Dexterity Saving Throw** to halve damage, you **take no damage** if you succeed and **only half damage** if you fail. If allies within **5' (1.5 m, 1 sq)** of you make the same save, you can grant them this effect for this save only. This ability does not apply if you are **Incapacitated**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 18**. **Superior Inspiration**: At the start of combat (when you roll **Initiative**), if you have fewer than **two Bardic Inspiration dice**, you regain **one** up to a maximum of **two**.\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 19**. **Epic Boon**: You gain **an Epic Boon** or another **Feat** of your choice: ![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 20**. **Words of Creation**: You master **2 Words of Creation (Life and Death)**. You always have **Power Word Heal** and **Power Word Kill** prepared. When you cast one of these spells, you can target a **second creature** within **10' (3 m, 2 sq)** of the first.\n\n---\n\n<br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)<br><br>![Ligne!](symbole/Ligne2010.png)

caracteristiques: \n\n---\n\n**Primary Ability:** **Charisma**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Hit Dice:** **1d8** per **Bard level**\n\n**Proficiencies:**&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;**Saving Throw Proficiencies:** **Dexterity** and **Charisma**\n\n- **Weapons:** **Simple Weapons**\n\n- **Armor:** **Light Armor**\n\n- **Tools** (choose 3 musical instruments)\n\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)![Ligne!](symbole/LigneD1.png)\n\n- don: ### **Class Feature**\n\n![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Level 1**. **Spellcasting (Bard)** : ![Case!](symbole/caseD2cocher.png) **Concentration**. All your **spell slots** are regained after a **Long Rest**.\n\n>- **Replace Prepared Spells**: After each **Bard level**, you can swap one spell and one cantrip.\n>- **Spellcasting Ability**: **Charisma**.\n>- **Spellcasting Focus**: You can use a **Musical Instrument** to cast your spells. Replaces non-costly material components.\n\n|Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | **Used<br>Slots** |Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots | **Used<br>Slots** |Spell<br>Level| Max<br>Slots |
